channel.title: CVE Feed for Adobe -- Photoshop
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Adobe -- Photoshop

item.title: CVE-2023-21576|2024-08-02T09:44:01.256Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Photoshop version 23.5.3 (and earlier), 24.1 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2023-21578|2024-08-02T09:44:01.188Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Photoshop version 23.5.3 (and earlier), 24.1 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass mitigations such as ASLR. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2023-21574|2024-08-02T09:44:01.283Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Photoshop version 23.5.3 (and earlier), 24.1 (and earlier) are affected by an Improper Input Validation vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2023-25908|2024-08-02T11:32:12.664Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 23.5.3 (and earlier) and 24.1.1 (and earlier) are affected by a Use After Free vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2023-21577|2024-08-02T09:44:01.100Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Photoshop version 23.5.3 (and earlier), 24.1 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass mitigations such as ASLR. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2023-21575|2024-08-02T09:44:01.249Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Photoshop version 23.5.3 (and earlier), 24.1 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.
